Pay_GroupObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Pay_GroupObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Pay_GroupObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Payee_Request_Criteria.description: Unique identifier used to reference an External Pay Group (e.g. a Pay Group marked as "Used in Payroll Interface")

PeriodObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Payee_Request_Criteria.description: Unique identifier used to reference a Pay Period.
Boolean attribute to signify whether the response data for Benefit Plan Data (within Deduction Data) should include Benefit Elections as of the Period Payment Date instead of the Period End Date.

validation.validation: Return Benefits Deductions as of Payment Date is only valid when a Period Reference is specified.

Payee_Request_Criteria.description: Boolean attribute to signify whether to include Employees who are currently Terminated, but were members of the Pay Group as of the Termination Date.

PeriodObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Include_Transfers_Out_Of_Pay_Group.description: Pay Period Reference representing the last time the web service operation was requested.  This period will be used to determine the members of the Pay Group as of the period.  For those that are no longer members, they will be included within the response.

validation.validation: Period End Date for Prior Period Reference must be less than or equal to Period End Date for above Period Reference (or current moment if omitted).
validation.description: Period End Date for Prior Period Reference must be less than or equal to Period End Date for above Period Reference (or current moment if omitted).

Include_Transfers_Out_Of_Pay_Group.description: As Of Entry DateTime used within the request for the last time this operation was submitted.  Used to determine the population of the Pay Group as of above Period for all data entered into the system prior to this Entry DateTime.

validation.validation: Prior As Of Entry DateTime (within the Include_Transfers_Out_Of_Pay_Group element) must be equal to or less than As Of Entry DateTime (within the Response_Filter element).
validation.description: Prior As Of Entry DateTime (within the Include_Transfers_Out_Of_Pay_Group element) must be equal to or less than As Of Entry DateTime (within the Response_Filter element).

Payee_Request_Criteria.description: Element to signify whether to include Employees who have transfered out of the Pay Group since the last time the web service operation was submitted.

Defines the latest moment (e.g. datetime) data was entered into the Workday system.
Defines the earliest Effective Date (e.g. As Of Date) data is marked within the Workday system.
Defines the latest Effective Date (e.g. As Of Date) data is marked within the Workday system.

Transaction_Log_Criteria.description: Encapsulating element containing Effective and Updated DateTime data.

validation.validation: Effective From must be less than or equal to Effective Through!
validation.description: Effective From must be less than or equal to Effective Through!

validation.description: If one of Effective From or Effective Through contains a value, both are Required!

Transaction_Log_TypeObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Transaction_Type_References.description: If specified, this search criterium will return those Transaction Log Entries with Transaction Types that match the search criterium.

Transaction_Log_Criteria.description: If specified, this search criteria will return those Transaction Log Entries which match the Transaction Types specified here.

SubscriberObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

SubscriberObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

SubscriberObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Transaction_Log_Criteria.description: If specified, this search criterium will return those Transaction Log Entries that match the Transaction Types defined in the subscription of the subscriber.

Payee_Request_Criteria.description: Searches the transaction log for business processes and event lites to find specific events that occurred during a period of time.  Changes to organization data such as organization name and code are not captured in the transaction log. The Organization Core Connector with the Transaction Service Log disabled can be used to detect organizations with organization data changes.When Transaction Log Criteria is configured, this web service will search through the transaction log looking for instances with a reference to an organization. Organizations are a very common reference in the transaction log  (e.g. role assignments are in the transaction log and typically reference an org). The more data that the transaction log has, the more data that needs to be evaluated by the web service.

validation.validation: Subscriber Reference must have an enabled Transaction Log Service configuration.
validation.description: Subscriber Reference must have an enabled Transaction Log Service configuration.

Payee_Request_Criteria.description: Boolean attribute to signify whether to include Costing Allocation data for the employee.
Used to indicate that the Pay Period Start and End dates should be used for Time Off entry selection.

The "as of the effective date" for the management chain, if different than the response filter "as of effective date."  This can be useful when a manager change is not due a staffing change in the managed worker's history.

When enabled, this option will use the respective Pay Period for Payroll Input Start and End Dates. This replaces the current behavior of using the Begin Entry Moment specified in the Response Date Range Filter to derive the period.
Boolean attribute to signify whether to include Employees who are Purged

Universal_IdentifierObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Payee_Request_Criteria.description: The universal identifier of the payees.  All payee roles will be returned for a given universal identifier.

description: Utilize the Request Criteria element to search the transaction log for specific instance(s) of a Payee (e.g. Employee).

validation.validation: Pay Period, if defined, must be valid for Pay Group.
validation.description: Pay Period, if defined, must be valid for Pay Group.

validation.validation: Return Benefits Deductions as of Payment Date is only applicable when specifying a Pay Period Reference.
validation.description: Return Benefits Deductions as of Payment Date is only applicable when specifying a Pay Period Reference.

validation.validation: Include Terminated Payees is only applicable when specifying a Pay Group Reference.
Include Transfers Out Of Pay Group is only applicable when specifying a Pay Group Reference.
Exclude Payee Reference is only applicable when specifying a Pay Group Reference.
Either Pay Group Reference, Payee Reference, or Universal ID Reference is required.

Payee_Response_Filter.description: Indicates the date when application data, such as benefits and compensation, become effective (Also referred to as the Effective Moment). If you don't specify a date, this date defaults to today.{+4}
The date and time the data was entered into the system. (This field is also referred to as the Entry Moment). If the date isn't specified, the default date is the current date and time.

The numbered page of data Workday returns in the response. The default page is the first page(Page = 1). For responses that contain more than one page of data, use this parameter to retrieve the additional pages of data. For example, set Page = 2 to retrieve the second page of data.Note: If you set the page parameter, you must also specify the "As_Of_Entry_Date" to ensure that the result set remains the same between your requests.
Sets the number of objects to return within each response page. Set a value between 1 and 999. The default value is 100.

description: Parameters that let you filter the data returned in the response. You can filter returned data by dates and page attributes.

Response_Date_Range_Filter.description: For Date Range type of data (e.g. historical entries between two dates), Begin Effective Date defines the farthest "From" date.  Note: most response data is considered snapshot data (e.g. as of a point in time); therefore, only certain types of response data will be affected by this date.

For Transactional type of data (e.g. entries as of a date but entered into Workday after a specific moment), Begin Entry Date Time defines the moment in time in which to look for transactions following.  Note: most response data is considered snapshot data (e.g. as of a point in time); therefore, only certain types of response data will be affected by this date.

description: In conjunction with the "Response_Filter" element, the "Response_Date_Range_Filter" element contains common WWS information that allows you control the transactional and/or date range data that you will be provided.

Payee_Response_Group.description: Indicates if the Reference element for the Payee (e.g. Employee) is included in the response.

description: The response groups allows for the amount of data contained within the response to be tailored to only included elements that the user is looking for.  If no response group is provided in the request, then ONLY the payee references will be returned. If no response group is provided AND the Page and Count parameters within the Response Filter element are also omitted, then ALL of the payee references will be returned in your response (no paging is performed).
